comments.body:
Document the defaults for both of these fields in the godoc.

Also, what happens when upgrading a cluster?  What if someone has failed jobs that they want to keep?  Will we suddenly purge them?

> Document the defaults for both of these fields in the godoc.

I haven't seen we document those defaults in the api, elsewhere. 



> Also, what happens when upgrading a cluster? What if someone has failed jobs that they want to keep? Will we suddenly purge them?

It looks like we will, but that's the whole point of introducing these with some reasonable values. We can't keep everything forever.

The vast majority of defaults are documented.  How else are users supposed to know what they are? 

Since that's potentially a data loss issue, you'll need to make very certain that the impacts of this are understood.  @kargakis did we do any prep for deployment cleanup?  At minimum the important release notes.

The other options is, since we're introducing `batch/v1beta1.CronJob` we could introduce these defaults there, and let the `batch/v2alpha1.CronJob` just introduce these fields, but without defaulting, wdyt?
@smarterclayton @soltysh is adding the defaults only for Deployments created in new clusters. Older Deployments shouldn't be pruned. https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/39683

Yeah, that was my proposal as well. We can introduce these fields, but only apply them to the new CronJobs created through new endpoint. I'm guessing Clayton's silence can be seen as a approval for this type of approach.
You need to copy all of the types from v1 here. Each version needs to be a complete set.
